metadata.title: CVE-2020-16119 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel exploitable by a localattacker due to reuse of a DCCP socket with an attached dccps_hc_tx_ccidobject as a listener after being released. Fixed in Ubuntu Linux kernel5.4.0-51.56, 5.3.0-68.63, 4.15.0-121.123, 4.4.0-193.224, 3.13.0.182.191 and3.2.0-149.196.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.3.0-68-generic - 5.3.0-68.63
linux-image-5.3.0-68-lowlatency - 5.3.0-68.63
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-68-generic - 5.3.0-68.63
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-68-lowlatency - 5.3.0-68.63
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1072-gke - 4.15.0-1072.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1049-gke - 5.0.0-1049.50
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1038-gke - 5.3.0-1038.40
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-oem - 4.15.0-1099.109
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1073-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1073.78
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-1035-raspi2 - 5.3.0-1035.37
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1089-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1089.98
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-68.63').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-kvm package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
